attributes.action: Review the Council Tax system so that it reflects individual contributions
attributes.background: I believe that the current Council Tax system is outdated and unfair - taxing households rather than individuals - Why should single households pay almost as much as a 5 occupancy household, why should a property worth millions pay same as a council flat?
attributes.additional_details:
Tax should be paid on individual bases and proportional to each person burden to the local authority - Should 2 pensionnaires household pay same council tax as a family of 5? Should a single working professional pay towards services it does not currently use?
Also with property valuation completely changed from 25 years ago - should household taxation still be considered an option? 
On top of that local councils have constantly risen tax/year and discrepancies between boroughs are huge.

attributes.action: The government should rethink its policies towards international students.
attributes.background:
A recent study* has shown that International Students make a net contribution of £2.3bn a year to the UK economy in London alone, as well as enhancing the UK's soft power globally.

However, the IPPR** claim current policy causes "unnecessary harm" to the UK's international education sector.
attributes.additional_details:
The IPPR*** make the following recommendations:
1. Students should be excluded from the drive to reduce net migration to tens of thousands.
2. The UK should set out a 10-year plan for expanding its international education sector.
3. The government should extend post-study work opportunities for international students.
4. Data collection methods should be improved to enable more robust assessment of migration patterns of international students.

* goo.gl/cT9o57
** goo.gl/R7Y8q3
*** goo.gl/7Nk9Vk

attributes.action: Make it law that all members of Parliament take regular drug and alcohol tests.
attributes.background: The government are accountable to the people and as most companies now test for drugs and alcohol so should Parliament as they shouldn't be running as ministers if under the influence

attributes.action: Reform the use and duration of Pre-Charge Bail
attributes.background: The current use of Pre-Charge Bail is unacceptable. Firstly, restrictions are imposed upon individuals who have not been charged with a crime, and imposed without evidence. Secondly, there is no maximum duration for this imposition, therefore suspects can be held in legal limbo for years.
attributes.additional_details:
What is Pre-Charge Bail?
Pre-charge bail is a legal loophole in which an individual who has been arrested, but not charged, can be placed on bail while police gather evidence. 

Prime Minister (then Home Secretary) Theresa May has said:
"I have been clear that it is simply not acceptable for individuals to spend months and in some cases years on pre-charge bail, with no system of review, only for charges never to be brought against them."

attributes.action: Instruct Southern Rail to reinvest all profits until they can run a full service
attributes.background: Southern Rail have been running a minimal and intermittant service while harvesting almost £100m in profit. Many of us will have had sympathy that they were dealing with a difficult situation with engineering work and civil action, however news that they are making such a profit shows otherwise.

attributes.action: Reduce the Foreign Aid budget and use the monies to fund Social Housing
attributes.background: Reduce the Foreign Aid Budget and use the monies to fund a Social Housing scheme to ensure all UK Veterans and homeless families have somewhere safe to live.  Any monies left can also fund Social Housing for the rest of the Country and then use the rents raised towards upkeep.

attributes.action: Organise better system at Dartford Toll. Delays of at least 2 hours unacceptable
attributes.background: I have been using this route for over 30 years and never experienced the delays as I am now, since removing the tolls. Something MUST be dine
attributes.additional_details: It does not matter what time of the day I leave my home in East Sussex, I am delayed for at least 1 and half hours - why??

attributes.action: Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016.
attributes.background:
Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016. Legal highs have been around for 20 years until the unsubstantiated hype of dangers.

We are in an era where countries are criminalising drugs and with this act the UK has gone backwards because of unsubstantiated hype.
attributes.additional_details:
We now know that former legal highs are available illegally and have become more dangerous. The industry still exists. It is wasting police time and resources when we should be focusing on terror and more important matters. Even the UN says drugs should be decriminalised.

UK Parliament has made more people into criminals when it is supposed to be criminal justice reform. The Equalities Commission & the PM said coloured people are more likely to go to jail this is racist legislation.

attributes.action: Give prisoners the right to vote
attributes.background: The European Court of Human Rights has told the UK it is violating a human right by not allowing prisoners to vote.The Government is choosing to ignore this, however this is preventing a true democracy in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: https://fullfact.org/law/votes-prisoners-politics-versus-human-rights-law/

attributes.action: liquid vapours for e cigs to be hidden behind shutters like cigarettes
attributes.background: Im a non smoking mum who knows many young children getting hooked on e cigs & vapour pens, which no doubt will continue onto cigarettes. Liquid vapour needs to be behind shutters like cigarettes. Currently being advertised like sweets in a sweetie shop. Needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently caught my 11 yr old son  a vapour pen! I discovered that most of the yr 6 in primary school were smoking. Advertising is aimed at kids lemon soufflé, trifle, bubble gum & Coca Cola flavours. Once hooked they will Start smoking cigarettes to increase the tobacco industry sales. 
Today most people are trying to quit smoking so hence tobacco sales declining. The tobacco industry are now hoping to encourage younger generation. These liquid vapours need to be behind closed doors.

attributes.action: Agree never to sell or give our NHS details to anyone outside the NHS.
attributes.background: Apparently this proposal is back again. There is a proposal to sell all our details to the private sector. This was defeated once and needs to be defeated again. Let's get it debated in Parliament.

attributes.action: Train more doctors.
attributes.background: To meet future demands for healthcare, whilst managing the hours worked by doctors, we need more doctors.  There are currently lots of talented people who want to train as doctors but can't because there are not enough places at medical schools.
attributes.additional_details: As well as increasing the number of training places available to people aged 18, the number of places available to people in their 20's (both with and without a first degree in another subject) should be significantly increased to improve access to medicine as a career.  Currently to secure a place at medical school you have to demonstate an excellent academic record, a committment to medicine and a track record of helping others, usually by the age of 17.

attributes.action: Impose restrictions on corner shops / off-licence shops using plastic bags.
attributes.background: We saw clear decline of using plastic bags after imposing 5p charge which benefit the environment a great deal. It is time to impose restrictions or small charge on corner shops / takeaways /  off-licence shops  etc.This will further cut out the mess on our streets and will benefit small business

attributes.action: Reduce the six week school holidays.
attributes.background: We are now in 2016 which is a different era from times gone by.  Parents work not every parent can rely on free childcare or assistance from grandparents.  When a child is away from school for such a long time it is a detriment to any educational development.
attributes.additional_details: Children go back to school forgetting what they have learned in the previous term.  Many children are not physically active and spend the six week holidays inactive.  Childcare is very expensive children expect to do activities which unfortunately very rarely are free.  Family life is stressful due to the time scale and general cost.  Holidays abroad double.  Time with family is important but we need to look at an agenda which helps parents rather than hinders.  If the holidays are going to continue there needs to be a scheme to aid parents.

attributes.action: Make the swegway/hoverboard no longer governed by the highways act of 1835.
attributes.background: The highways act of 1835 was clearly not written with the swegway in mind. They are smaller than a baby's pram and a disability scooter and people are allowed to use them in public, so it is unjust for the swegway to be singled out and banned in public places.
attributes.additional_details: At the very least they should be legal in public parks as bikes, being much faster than a swegway, are allowed to be in parks but swegways are not.

attributes.action: Benefit sanctions must be stopped without exception.
attributes.background: Benefit sanctions are being handed out unlawfully.

attributes.action: Remove roadside signs supported on steel girders
attributes.background: As a retained firefighter for Hampshire Fire and Rescue Service I have recently attended  an rtc where a van came into contact with a roadside motorway sign which was mounted on steel girders. This collision left the driver with life changing injuries. There are a number of these signs on the m3.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the construction of these signs is a danger to life and there appears to be more lightweight options available that are in use in other areas of the motorway system. A vehicle coming into contact with these signs supported on steel girders will quiet simply be cut in half by the force of the collision. I recently attended an incident on the m3 near Basingstoke where a driver lost a leg.

attributes.action: Review and reform behavior during debates within the House of Commons.
attributes.background: Many citizens of this country are  appalled by the jeering, cheering, and most unacceptably, laughter that characterizes PMQs and every other debate that takes place in the chamber at The House of Commons. This childish behavior demonstrates a general disinterest in engaging in robust debate.
attributes.additional_details: When the future of this country is being discussed, when welfare cuts that destroy lives and families are being discussed, it is disgusting to see jokes being made and heartily laughed at. General disorder slows the processes of power and disrupts the scrutiny of government. An immediate review and reform of the guidelines of MPs parliamentary behavior should be enacted. Those who cannot behave in a way befitting the seriousness of political discourse should be disciplined.

attributes.action: Make tools VAT exempt for PAYE employed tradesman
attributes.background: Many workers employed in different trades are required to purchase and maintain their own hand tools and tool storage. It is unfair and unreasonable that there should be VAT levied on such items as they are not purchased for want but out of necessity

attributes.action: Help from the NHS to provide more mental health support for people aged 16-18.
attributes.background: The NHS have many adolescent services but long waiting lists mean that support is unavailable when people most critically need it. When people reach 17, they no longer fit the criteria for an adolescent patient, but don't fit in the age range for adult services, so they are left without support.
attributes.additional_details: Being left to find private services at the age of 17 can be very difficult for families as a result of the very high prices. The cost of services can prevent these people from getting the support they need. This time without care can be very detrimental to a young person with poor mental health, so therefore the gap between adolescent and adult services needs to be filled.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for any councillor to fail to pay council tax.
attributes.background: As a lawyer and council tax payer I read of an increasing number of councillors who fail to pay their council tax and this problem cannot be allowed to continue

attributes.action: Heavier prison scentences for pedophiles and rapists.
attributes.background: I firmly believe that the scentences handed out to pedophiles and rapists are far to lenient.When someone commits a crime against a child or rapes a person they are as good as murdering who that person once was
attributes.additional_details: Anyone who has been raped or abused will tell you they will never be the same again...in essence the person they once were is now dead...children who are abused have their childhood stolen from them..the perpetrators of such unspeakble acts deserve to be punished severly and the victims at the very least deserve the justice that harsher scentences would bring

attributes.action: Speed up DBS checks
attributes.background: Care companies are in crisis due to the waiting time for DBS checks. Staff only have to give a months notice to leave  but to get new staff to cover them can take months, It is hard enough getting staff to work in the care industry and many give up the wait after 4 weeks as need to be in paid work.

attributes.action: Fully fund A&E and urgent care by a specific A&E tax paid by most people.
attributes.background: There is national alarm at the state of many A and E departments with excessive waiting times and some inappropriate use by people who should be treated elsewhere. Separate funding paid for fully by a broad based tax to which most if not all contribute is needed to provide sufficient urgent care.
attributes.additional_details:
Refer to sensible views of Philippa Whitford in the NHS and Social Care funding in the House of Commons on Jan 11th 2017. She presents the impressive model as practised in Scotland.
Everyone knows that A and E is not coping in many parts of the country. This is exacerbated by the lack of GP availability out of hours and at weekends. Demand has risen due to an ageing population and lack of alternative facilities. A and E is one of the few services that virtually everybody will use in their lives.

attributes.action: Consider a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt, Secretary of state for Health
attributes.background: The Independent exposes the collusion of Jeremy Hunt,  Department of Health and the HEE  to impose junior doctor contracts. Health Education England is meant to be an INDEPENDENT body  responsible for the teaching and training of health care staff. Mr Hunt cannot be trusted with future of our NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
6th January 2017 article in the Independent 
Emails show Jeremy Hunt’s Department of Health 'colluded' with ‘independent’ body to impose junior doctor contracts
Emails seen by The Independent reveal collaboration with Health Education England, which provides NHS trusts with £3.65bn of funding every year

attributes.action: Award a campaign medal for members of Bomber Command in WW2.
attributes.background: 55,573 members of Bomber Command were killed in WW2 and have never received any official recognition for their sacrifice. It is time this injustice was corrected.

attributes.action: To make a ban on eating disorder websites or videos as this destroys lives.
attributes.background: This is something that effects me. I think that promoting the way doing eating disorders is disgusting and should be a crime as it affects lives. I have seen all these websites where they tell best was to purge (throwing up food). This is horrible and needs to stop as this is killing people.
attributes.additional_details: The are many horrible web sites like these that need to be banned as they are destroying lives and families. Please help me stop these horrible websites as they are messing peoples lives.

attributes.action: Make it 'illegal' to setup None Legal Encampment's, with the Police given Powers
attributes.background:
The Police must be given the Powers to Remove people as they Arrive, it should not be for the Councils and Land Owners to Waste money taking Action, also any Mess/Damage must be got from the ones who caused it like breaking in, and Human Waste.
At this time it is Unfair that Council Money is Waste
attributes.additional_details:
Some in the Traveling sector cause issues with Locals, Fly Tip, our council plus the City council have had to pay out good money in Repairs with one area which a school uses closed for eight days cleaning up their mess and repairs to the grass area, another they lifted out posts to a play area, cut chains on gates Only to be moved on to do the same again, No Law in this practice.

Let's make the Laws apply to All.

attributes.action: Give HMRC more funding to help stamp out tax evasion.
attributes.background: Tax fraud costs the government  £16bn every year. HMRC are making cuts to "save money" in reality these job losses are hurting the economy. Tax avoidance is hurting services like the NHS and is leading to low earning citizens having to pay higher taxes. Sign to make the government give more funding.

attributes.action: Make Helium Balloons Illegal
attributes.background: I am always seeing helium balloons. Helium is a limited resource so should not be used for balloons, especially as helium can be used for important MRI scanners. This gas is lighter than air and will never be seen again if it floats away. So please support me in my hope to ban helium balloons.
attributes.additional_details:
When pressure becomes too much for a balloon it will pop, and the foil balloon will land in the ocean- a innocent sea creature will eat it and die.
Helium is a limited resource and is needed for MRI scanners to work. Helium is the only element out of all 118 in the periodic table that can cool the electromagnets to the right temperature for the scanner to work. One day helium may save your life.

attributes.action: Make Personal Development classes part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Sources suggest that on average, children spend just under 800 hours in a classroom each year! During this time a range of subjects will be taught and skills will be gained. However, in the midst of Maths, Science, PE and others, when do you hear kids shouting "I'm off to Personal Development Class"
attributes.additional_details:
I do not have an issue with the standard of education our children get, but I want them to have an opportunity each week to work on Developing themselves, to learn and build on attributes such as Resilience, Self Motivation and Empathy to name a few. 

“A teacher has two jobs: fill young minds with knowledge, yes, but more important, give those minds a compass so that that knowledge doesn't go to waste.” - Mr Hollands Opus 1995 (movie)

attributes.action: Make universal credit phone numbers free
attributes.background: Sign this because it is ridiculous to phone up for help with benefits and money and to have a huge phone bill at the end!

attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of media bias in secondary education
attributes.background: Everyday we are fed information from the media, be it TV, newspapers, news sites, billboards, etc. The media needs money, and so they will do what they need to do to be financially viable, going as far as inciting hate. Compulsory teaching of media bias may help people make more informed choices.

attributes.action: Provide New Zealand with aid to help them rebuild after the earthquake.
attributes.background: In light of the two earthquakes that have just hit the New Zealand south island on 13th Nov, the British Government should provide aid to assist the government and people of New Zealand to rebuild their infrastructure. The money should come from the overseas aid budget

attributes.action: Consider a Nationalised, funded Mental Health First Response Service.
attributes.background: UK Police Forces and NHS services now spend around 30% of their time responding to Mental Health sufferers who do not receive the best attention or assistance. A MH Service that are the first responders to Suicide risks and Sectioning requests, who can convey MH Patients to the correct facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Working in the Police, it is being increasingly more and more difficult to tackle Crime and deal with Community issues, when every 3 or 4 of 10 incidents we are responding to are for Mental Health patients that require specialised help that we cannot provide. 
This is tying up Emergency resourcing that can be better used elsewhere, and would provide MH patients with the best care and help possible.
Sectioning people and attending Suicide Risks would be better dealt by more a appropriate agency

attributes.action: Bring 'Hands-on' STEM Back to Schools
attributes.background: As a STEM Educator and STEM Charity Owner, a important issue has come to light, that a lot of 'Hands-on' STEM skills have been stripped from young people's STEM education, leading to a large skill short-fall when student's carry on studying STEM subjects at university.
attributes.additional_details: Information about this subject has been collected and analysed by volunteers at GlamSci (www.GlamSci.org) whom are a non-profit STEM educational charity concerned with young people's education and rights to STEM subjects. This view is backed by current educational figures gathered by STEM governing bodies, universities and other educational organisations.

attributes.action: Prevent companies from defaulting the 'save payment information' on a website
attributes.background: Typically when purchasing online goods, companies by default check the 'Save these payment details'. Saving payment details online isn't a good thing and whilst the option should be there, it shouldn't be defaulted. This should be addressed and could potentially save people from fraudulent purchases
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was the victim of fraud as I may have mistakenly saved my payment card details on a website that was later compromised.

attributes.action: Make Marcus Jones review his choice to turn down the funding for mk homeless
attributes.background: Over the last year we have had three of our homeless die on the streets.. There are also people living in  Substandard temporary accommodation in and out of the city. Please review your decision to turn down funding that would of helped these people the government have forgotten
attributes.additional_details:
We have over 500 family's that are homeless... This money would of helped the local authority to provide 50 units to help home these people the gvmt have forgotten... 
People are dying on our streets.. 
Marcus Jones please fully review your decision. 
And give us an answer as to why you turned down the application! 

Thank you

attributes.action: Private companies must allow 10 minutes before issue of a parking invoice.
attributes.background: Many retail parks, housing developments and busimesses use private parking companies to control parking in their carparks or roads. We believe these companies should be legally required to allow the driver to overstay by a maximum of ten minutes, just as traffic wardens and council wardens have to.
attributes.additional_details: If you are held up at the till because there are not enough staff at the checkouts, is it fair to be charged by the parking company that the store employs? Is it right to receive a ticket because you pulled up at your door to unload shopping before taking your car to the official car park? No, it isn't. These charges are exhorbitant and unfair. They should have to allow at least a few minutes grace before pouncing and issuing a fine.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to close St Bart's Hospital, Rochester, Kent.
attributes.background: There is a lack of provisions in the Medway Towns as it is and we need this hospital. It was used as a rehab hospital for stroke patients and anyone else who needed a longer stay in the hospital. Medway Maritime Hospital will only allow people to stay short term as they need the beds.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a brief history of the hospital; this is one of the oldest hospitals in Britain, having been founded in 1078 by Gundulph, Bishop of Rochester, for the "poor and leprous". The current hospital building in New Road, Rochester was built in 1861.  The hospital relied on charity donations until 1948 when it was funded by the NHS.

We don't want this historic building to end up in the wrong hands because they may demolish this gothic style building and a piece of Medway history will be gone!

attributes.action: Change the way Tax Credits are calculated to stop overpayments
attributes.background:
Tax credits are state benefits that provide extra money to people responsible for children, disabled workers and other workers on lower incomes.
Have you ever had an over payment for Tax Credits even though you advised them straight away of your change of circumstances as they asked? read on..
attributes.additional_details:
Have you ever received an over payment for Tax Credits?
This is because HMRC calculate your entitlement over a 12 month period they predict that your situation will remain the same for these 12 months, so if you then change your circumstances more than likely you will get an over payment usually in the £100's.
I suggest they calculate it weekly or monthly and remain the same each week/month unless we advise them of any changes and hopefully see over payments £10-30 instead of putting us in debt.

attributes.action: Make it Law for drivers involved in a accident to report to police at the scene
attributes.background: Drivers are able to leave the scene of an accident and be within the law to report it within 24 hours, therefore police are unable to take correct alcohol and drug samples, giving a possible lighter sentence.
attributes.additional_details: Ben regan was killed by a driver who failed to stop and drove home and hid the car, and called the police 10 hours after, to plead not guilty to a careless driving charge due to lack of evidence. Family's are being put through hell because of this loophole. It must be stopped.

attributes.action: Ensure that in future 65% of eligible voters are required to pass a referendum.
attributes.background: For changes that would have a profound effect on the nation its constitution and its people a clear 65% of eligible voters should be the mark so there can be no doubt as to the legitimacy of the vote. In addition Parliament should be legally obliged to honour any passed referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Previous referendums are held at the first past 50% of those that voted is all that is needed to carry a referendum this could be seen as undemocratic as it is not based on the eligible voting public. Also allowing such tight voting margins can be seen to be a cause of civil unrest.

attributes.action: Start making Gazumping Illegal.
attributes.background: We put in an offer for a House about 3 weeks ago it got accepted. Mortgage approved everything. Then Tuesday 1st November 2016 got told that someone put in a Higher  offer and that got accepted. So now left High and Dry.
attributes.additional_details: We don't want this happening to other people

attributes.action: Eliminate residency requirements when determining a British Citizens fee status
attributes.background: As a British citizen, one can expect fair and just treatment in their country; one should not be treated any differently than fellow Britons. Currently, a citizen must live in the UK for the 3 year before starting a university course, which discriminates against citizens who live abroad.
attributes.additional_details: With the current fee status terms, many British citizens are classified as international students when returning to their home. Not only are international fees extortionate, this means that a citizen is treated no differently than a foreigner when they are in their own country. These fees may even impede a citizen from returning home. In order to end this discrimination, fee status should be based upon citizenship; a Briton should be considered a Briton, regardless of where s/he has lived.

attributes.action: Change Religious Education to Religious and Cultural Studies
attributes.background: Students should be taught more than just basic religious principles. Teaching children about other races and cultures will help stamp out racism in our ever-progressing and diverse society.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the biggest cities in the UK (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol and Cardiff) are among the most diverse in Europe. Our youth should be accepting of their peers whatever their heritage, especially in the wake of Brexit and the rising level of hate crime.

attributes.action: Increase the number of years required to be eligible for UK citizenship
attributes.background: If refugees or persons with humanitarian protection can stay in the UK for 5 years and then be eligible for UK citizenship after 5 years, it discourages those from ever returning home once it is safe to do so.
attributes.additional_details: In Norway you have to wait 7 years, in Germany you have to wait 8 years, in Switzerland 10 years, and so on. I think there is a debate to be had about increasing the number of years to be eligible for UK citizenship.

attributes.action: Allow the continued use of A2 motorcycle restrictor kits.
attributes.background: The plan to prohibit current use of A2 restrictor kit seems unfair to a lot of riders as this is a step up for their current A1 licence restricting the to 125cc motorcycles. The UK is one of the strictest if not the strictest when it comes to motorcycle laws,this is a step in the wrong direction.

attributes.action: Halt the Department of Education's Autumn Census & destroy all data collected.
attributes.background: The Department of Education's Autumn Census expects parents to disclose their children Country of Birth and state 'National Identity' from a list of Welsh, English, Scottish, Irish, British, Other, or Refuse. Parents should not be asked to determine and disclose the national identity of children.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for food outlets to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background:
In the uk it is not a legal requirement for food outlets to display their food hygiene ratings. 
 

Many people don't know that you can check online, many people assume the government wouldn't allow somewhere to be open if they received 0-1-2 stars. 

But they are aloud to stay open.
attributes.additional_details:
Check out local places in your area. 
http://ratings.food.gov.uk

My local chicken shop received a 0..
Local Costcutter received a 1
Local Cafe received a 1
All are still open.

Major improvements required
System or checks in place to ensure that food sold or served is safe to eat, the food safety officer has confidence that standards will be maintained in future.

Cleanliness and condition of facilities and building to enable good food hygiene.

http://www.youtube.com/user/FoodStandardsAgency
